unnormalised: What are some effective government schemes for higher education in India?
normalised: What are some effective government schemes for higher education in India?

unnormalised: India has several govt. schemes aimed at making higher education accessible & affordable. One notable scheme is the "Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan" (PM-USHA). This scheme focuses on improving the overall quality of state higher education institutions by providing funding for infrastructure development, faculty recruitment, and research. Institutions can apply for grants based on specific project proposals. Also important to mention is the scheme for "Interest Subsidy on Education Loans for the Economically Weaker Sections (I.S.)". This provides interest subsidies on education loans taken by students from EWS categories, allowing them to pursue professional courses after 12th without being burdened by high interest rates.
normalised: India has several government schemes aimed at making higher education accessible and affordable. One notable scheme is the "Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan" (P-M-U-S-H-A). This scheme focuses on improving the overall quality of state higher education institutions by providing funding for infrastructure development, faculty recruitment, and research. Institutions can apply for grants based on specific project proposals. Also important to mention is the scheme for "Interest Subsidy on Education Loans for the Economically Weaker Sections (I-S)". This provides interest subsidies on education loans taken by students from E-W-S categories, allowing them to pursue professional courses after twelfth without being burdened by high interest rates.

unnormalised: Another beneficial scheme is the "National Scholarship Portal" (NSP), which acts as a central platform for various scholarship schemes offered by the Central Government, State Governments and other organizations. Students can apply for scholarships like the "Central Sector Scheme of Scholarship for College and University Students" directly through the NSP portal. These scholarships provide financial assistance of upto Rs. 20,000 per annum, helping students cover their tuition fees and other academic expenses. Also, the "AICTE Scholarship Scheme" offers financial aid to students pursuing technical education at AICTE approved institutions.

unnormalised: Finally, don't forget the various State Government initiatives. For example, the "Medhavi Vidyarthi Yojana" in M.P. provides financial assistance to meritorious students based on their 12th board exam scores. These schemes often have specific eligibility criteria, such as income limits and academic performance requirements, so students should check the official govt websites for detailed info. Overall, the Indian government offers a range of higher education schemes and these schemes can be found with a quick search, using keywords such as "MHRD scholarships", or "UGC schemes for students" to find the most relevant and up-to-date opportunities.
